quizDescription: Test your knowledge about the incomparable Stevie Wonder, his groundbreaking music, and his lasting impact on the industry!
quizTags: Stevie Wonder, Music, R&B, Soul, Motown

questions.question: What is Stevie Wonder's real name?
questions.explanation: Stevie Wonder's real name is Stevland Hardaway Morris. He adopted the stage name 'Stevie Wonder' early in his career.

questions.question: Stevie Wonder signed with which iconic record label, where he gained fame and released many of his classic hits?
questions.explanation: Stevie Wonder signed with Motown Records, where he gained fame and released many of his classic hits. Motown played a pivotal role in shaping his early career.

questions.question: Stevie Wonder's first Grammy Award came in 1967 for his hit song:
questions.explanation: Stevie Wonder's first Grammy Award came in 1967 for his hit song 'For Once in My Life.' The song showcased his exceptional vocal and musical talents.

questions.question: Which Stevie Wonder album earned him the Grammy Award for Album of the Year in 1974?
options: Songs in the Key of Life
questions.explanation: Stevie Wonder's album 'Innervisions' earned him the Grammy Award for Album of the Year in 1974. The album is considered one of his masterpieces.

questions.question: Which Stevie Wonder song includes the lyrics: 'Isn't she lovely? Isn't she wonderful? Isn't she precious?'
options: I Just Called to Say I Love You
You Are the Sunshine of My Life
questions.answer: Isn't she lovely? Isn't she wonderful? Isn't she precious?
questions.explanation: The song 'Isn't She Lovely' includes the lyrics: 'Isn't she lovely? Isn't she wonderful? Isn't she precious?' Stevie Wonder wrote the song to celebrate the birth of his daughter Aisha.

questions.question: Stevie Wonder received a Grammy Award for Best Male Pop Vocal Performance for which song?
options: You Are the Sunshine of My Life
questions.answer: You Are the Sunshine of My Life
questions.explanation: Stevie Wonder received a Grammy Award for Best Male Pop Vocal Performance for the song 'You Are the Sunshine of My Life.' The song became one of his signature hits.

questions.question: Stevie Wonder's album 'Songs in the Key of Life' features which hit song that pays tribute to jazz musicians?
questions.explanation: Stevie Wonder's album 'Songs in the Key of Life' features the hit song 'Sir Duke,' which pays tribute to jazz musicians Duke Ellington, Ella Fitzgerald, and Count Basie.

questions.question: What was Stevie Wonder's first solo single to reach number one on the Billboard Hot 100 chart?
options: I Just Called to Say I Love You
You Are the Sunshine of My Life
questions.explanation: Stevie Wonder's first solo single to reach number one on the Billboard Hot 100 chart was 'Superstition.' The song became one of his most successful hits.

questions.question: Stevie Wonder's song 'Higher Ground' has been covered by many artists, but which iconic rock band also released a version of the song?
questions.explanation: The iconic rock band Red Hot Chili Peppers also released a version of Stevie Wonder's song 'Higher Ground' in 1989. Their cover was well-received by fans and critics.

questions.question: Stevie Wonder was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom in which year?
questions.explanation: Stevie Wonder was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation's highest civilian honor, by President Barack Obama in 2014. The award recognized his contributions to American culture and music.
